definition[0]: something long and thin with a sharp point, especially a pointed piece of metal
definition[1]: a sudden large increase in the number or rate of something
definition[2]: to secretly add strong alcohol or a drug to someoneâ€™s drink or food
example[1]: The orange juice had been spiked with gin.
definition[3]: if the number or rate of something spikes, it increases quickly and by a large amount
example[2]: New telephone orders have spiked in the last two years.
definition[4]: to push a sharp tool or object into something
definition[5]: to prevent someone from saying something or printing something in a newspaper
example[3]: a clumsy attempt to spike rumours of a cabinet split
definition[6]: to powerfully throw an American football down on the ground to celebrate a touchdown
definition[7]: to powerfully hit a volleyball down over the net
